intro: Centaurea musarum, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant features upright, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are bright blue or purple, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Centaurea musarum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields.
